tooltips.nudge_uprof:
Selectively apply nudging to U:
OFF = Switch off nudging
ON = Apply nudging everywhere
WINDOW = Apply window function to nudging tendencies.
0 = OFF
1 = ON
2 = WINDOW
tooltips.nudge_ucoef: Selectively adjust the nudging strength applied to U. (normalized) [0.,1.]
tooltips.nudge_hwin_lat0: Specify the horizontal center of the window (lat0) in degrees. [-90., +90.]
tooltips.nudge_hwin_lon0: Specify the horizontal center of the window (lon0) in degrees. [0., 360.]
tooltips.nudge_hwin_latwidth:
Specify the lat width of the horizontal window in degrees.
Setting a width to a large value (e.g. 999.) renders the window constant in that direction.
>0
tooltips.nudge_hwin_lonwidth:
Specify the lon width of the horizontal window in degrees.
Setting a width to a large value (e.g. 999.) renders the window constant in that direction.
>0
tooltips.nudge_vwin_invert:
A logical flag used to invert the horizontal window function to get its complement.
True/False
tooltips.nudge_hwin_invert:
A logical flag used to invert the horizontal window function to get its complement.
(e.g. to nudge outside a given window)
True/False
tooltips.nudge_timescale_opt:
Select the timescale for the relaxation:
WEAK = Constant time scale based on the interval of Target values.
STRONG = Variable timescale which gets stronger near each Target time.
0 = WEAK
1 = STRONG
tooltips.nudge_force_opt:
Select the form of the Target values:
NEXT = Target at next future time
LINEAR = Linearly interpolate Target values to current model time.
0 = NEXT
1 = LINEAR
